item.dc:creator: @Sin2 Sin_
item.description:
@Sin2 wrote:

nd w0t:

UMM THATS WHAT I HAD…

No you didn’t, cases don’t need an opening bracket and you didn’t have a closing bracket before the break;

item.title: Case Help
item.dc:creator: @Sin2 Sin_
item.description:
@Sin2 wrote:

Edit: You are dumb in my opinion. I hope you have every statement in that packet is declared. The correct way is:

case 4827:
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("PLAYERNAME")
{
int X = server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absX;
int Y = server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absY;
int offsetX = (absX - X) * -1;
int offsetY = (absY - Y) * -1;
dbow = true;
createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 80, 249, 60, 31, AttackingOn + 1);
createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 80, 249, 40, 31, AttackingOn + 1);
dbowtimer = 2;
PkingDelay = 5;
UseBow = true;
startAnimation(426);
} 
else 
{
sendMessage("MESSAGE");
}
break;

Read full topic

item.title: Case Help
item.dc:creator: @nd_w0t nd w0t
item.description:
@nd_w0t wrote:

K i added a case for an item…

case 4827://BLAH
int X = server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absX;
int Y = server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absY;
int offsetX = (absX - X) * -1;
int offsetY = (absY - Y) * -1;
dbow = true;
createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 80, 249, 60, 31, AttackingOn + 1);
createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 80, 249, 40, 31, AttackingOn + 1);
dbowtimer = 2;
PkingDelay = 5;
UseBow = true;
startAnimation(426);
}
break;

Okay, how would i make it so, only a certain person could wield this item?.. Would it be like…

case 4827://DarkBowForLively
{
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("PLAYERNAME"))
int X = server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absX;
int Y = server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absY;
int offsetX = (absX - X) * -1;
int offsetY = (absY - Y) * -1;
dbow = true;
createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 80, 249, 60, 31, AttackingOn + 1);
createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 80, 249, 40, 31, AttackingOn + 1);
dbowtimer = 2;
PkingDelay = 5;
UseBow = true;
startAnimation(426);
} else {
sendMessage("MESSAGE");
break;

I get errors when doing that…

client.java:2619: '.class' expected
int X = server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absX;
    ^
client.java:2619: not a statement
int X = server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absX;
^
client.java:2630: 'else' without 'if'
} else {
  ^
client.java:2630: case, default, or '}' expected
} else {
       ^
client.java:2631: case, default, or '}' expected
sendMessage("MESSAGE");
^
client.java:2631: case, default, or '}' expected
sendMessage("MESSAGE");
           ^
client.java:2631: case, default, or '}' expected
sendMessage("MESSAGE");
            ^
client.java:2631: case, default, or '}' expected
sendMessage("MESSAGE");
                     ^
client.java:2631: case, default, or '}' expected
sendMessage("MESSAGE");
                      ^
client.java:2632: case, default, or '}' expected
break;
^
client.java:2632: case, default, or '}' expected
break;

11… When i add another “}” after

sendMessage("MESSAGE");

I get 100… anyone help me solve this?

Appreciated, thanks[br][size=1]Posted on: September 14, 2007, 11:56:27 AM[/size][hr]Cmon?..[br][size=1]Posted on: September 14, 2007, 01:07:48 PM[/size][hr]Omfg bottom of the page… 18 views… STILL NO1 THAT KNOWS?.. CMON…

Sorry for posting :S
[center] Rule 5, re-read the rules.
http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,3.0.html[/center]
